title: Variable Declaration
description: Find the syntax error in variable declaration.
explanation: Missing initializer in const declaration 'z'. 'const' variables must be initialized during declaration.

title: Equality Operator
explanation: The code is syntactically correct and will output 'true' then 'false'. The question asks if the code snippet itself is valid/correct which it is.

title: Function Syntax
description: Identify the error in the function definition.
explanation: Arrow functions with a block body '{}' must explicitly use the 'return' keyword to return a value. Either add 'return' or remove the braces.

title: Array method push
description: Does push return the new array?
explanation: Array.prototype.push returns the new length of the array, not the array itself. So newArr will be 3, not [1, 2, 3].

title: For Loop Syntax
description: Find the syntax error in the loop.
explanation: Missing semicolon after the condition 'i < 10'. It should be 'for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++)'.

title: String Concatenation
codeSnippet:
let result = '10' + 20;
console.log(typeof result); // output: string
explanation: In JavaScript, adding a string and a number results in string concatenation. '1020' is a string.

title: Object Literal
description: Find the syntax error in the object.
explanation: Missing comma after the property 'age: 30'. Properties in an object literal must be separated by commas.

title: Null vs Undefined
explanation: null == undefined is true, but null === undefined is false. The code is valid.

title: Switch Statement
explanation: Missing colon after 'case 'red''. It should be "case 'red':".

title: Const Reassignment
explanation: Assignment to constant variable is not allowed. This will throw a TypeError.

title: Template Literals
description: Find the error in string interpolation.
explanation: Incorrect syntax for template literal interpolation. It should be '${name}', not '{name}'.

title: typeof operator
explanation: typeof [] returns 'object', not 'array'. To check for an array, use Array.isArray().

title: Unclosed String
explanation: Terminating string quote is missing. The string starting with " must end with ".

title: Function Hoisting
explanation: Function declarations are hoisted in JavaScript, so they can be called before they are defined in the code.

title: Invalid Variable Name
explanation: Variable names cannot start with a number. '1stPlace' is an invalid identifier.

title: NaN comparison
explanation: The code runs, but it prints 'false' because NaN is not equal to anything, including itself. The code snippet itself is syntactically correct.

title: Console Log Typo
explanation: Typo in 'console'. 'csnole' is not defined (unless defined elsewhere, which is unlikely here).

title: Boolean Conversion
explanation: Empty string is falsy in JavaScript, so this will print 'False'. The code is correct.

title: Missing Parentheses
description: Identify the syntax error in if.
explanation: The condition in an 'if' statement must be enclosed in parentheses: 'if (age >= 18)'.

title: Logical OR
explanation: Valid usage of logical OR for default values. Since user is null (falsy), name becomes 'Guest'.

title: Reserved Word
explanation: 'class' is a reserved keyword in JavaScript and cannot be used as a variable name.

title: Unary Plus
explanation: The unary plus operator converts its operand to a number (if possible). Code is correct.

title: Method Typo
description: Find the error in array method.
explanation: Missing closing parenthesis for the forEach method call. Should be '});' or '})'.

title: Scope var vs let
explanation: 'var' is function-scoped (or global), not block-scoped. So x is visible outside the if block.

title: Getter Syntax
explanation: Syntax error: The object literal is not closed properly with '}'. Also the console.log is seemingly inside or mixed up. The block structure is broken.

title: Arrow Functions arguments
explanation: Arrow functions do not have their own 'arguments' object. This will likely throw a ReferenceError (in strict mode or if not defined globally).

title: Strict Equality
explanation: Using assignment operator '=' instead of equality comparison '==' or '==='. While valid syntax, it's usually a logic error, but in code review context it can be flagged. Wait, is it a syntax error? No. But snippet asks 'Find the line with the syntax error' usually or just error. Let's say logic error. But strict checking might catch this.

title: Destructuring Assignment
codeSnippet:
const user = { name: "Bob", age: 25 };
const { name, age } = user;
explanation: Correct syntax for object destructuring.

title: Uncaught Reference
explanation: Variable 'abc' is used but not defined anywhere, leading to a ReferenceError.

title: String length
explanation: Strings are immutable primitive values in JS. Setting the length property has no effect (in strict mode it throws). In non-strict it is ignored. So logic-wise it's correct that it prints 5.

title: Async Await Usage
description: Find error in async function usage.
explanation: 'await' is only valid in async functions and the top level bodies of modules. 'fetchData' needs 'async' keyword.

title: Array Sort Mutation
explanation: Array.prototype.sort() sorts the elements of an array in place and returns the reference to the same array.

title: Import Syntax
explanation: Unterminated string constant. Missing closing quote for 'react'.

title: Object Keys Order
codeSnippet:
const obj = { b: 2, a: 1 };
console.log(Object.keys(obj)); // ['b', 'a'] in most modern engines
explanation: Modern JS engines (ES2015+) preserve key insertion order for string keys (except for integer-like keys which are sorted). So ['b', 'a'] is correct.

title: Class Constructor
explanation: Reference to 'name' is missing 'this'. It should be 'this.name'.

title: Map Keys
explanation: Map allows any type of value (objects or primitives) to be used as either a key or a value.

title: Variable Shadowing Error
Promise.all fail fast
explanation: Promise.all fails immediately if any of the input promises reject. The catch block captures the first rejection.

title: Redeclaration of Variable
explanation: Identifier 'user' has already been declared. You cannot redeclare a 'let' variable in the same scope.

title: JSON.parse
explanation: Correct usage of JSON.parse with a valid JSON string.

title: Missing Super Call
explanation: Must call 'super()' before accessing 'this' in a derived class constructor.

title: Set Uniqueness
explanation: Set objects store unique values of any type. Duplicate '2' is removed.

title: Function Parameter syntax
explanation: While syntactically allowed in JS, defining required parameters (c) after default parameters (b=1) is bad practice and confusing. Often considered an error in strict linters.

title: Global variables
explanation: Without 'var', 'let', or 'const', assigning to a variable creates an implicit global (in non-strict mode). Code works.

title: Invalid Property Access
explanation: Dot notation cannot be used for keys with hyphens. Use bracket notation: obj['my-key'].

title: Function expression name
codeSnippet:
const f = function g() { return 1; };
// console.log(g());
explanation: The name 'g' is local to the function body. Calling g() outside throws ReferenceError. The snippet implies calling g() outside.

title: Trailing Comma syntax
Spread operator object
explanation: Object spread syntax copies own enumerable properties from p1 to p2.

title: Try Catch Syntax
explanation: 'finally' block does not take arguments. Syntax error: 'finally { ... }'.

title: Array includes
explanation: Array.includes() determines whether an array includes a certain value.

title: Regex Syntax
explanation: Unterminated regular expression literal. Missing closing '/'.

title: Object freeze
codeSnippet:
const obj = Object.freeze({ k: 1 });
obj.k = 2; // fails silently or throws in strict
explanation: Object.freeze prevents modification of properties. The assignment fails (silently in non-strict mode), but the code itself runs.

title: Import outside module
explanation: 'import' and 'export' may only appear at the top level of a module. Dynamic imports using import() function are allowed, but static import statement is not.

title: Generator Function
explanation: Correct syntax for a generator function using function*.

title: Delete Operator
explanation: The delete operator cannot delete variables declared with var, let, or const. It only works on object properties. (In strict mode this throws SyntaxError).

title: Instanceof check
explanation: instanceof operator tests whether the prototype property of a constructor appears anywhere in the prototype chain of an object.

title: Undefined Variable in Loop
explanation: Variable 'i' is implicit global because it lacks var/let/const declaration. While it runs in loose mode, it's flagged as an error in strict environments.

title: Symbol uniqueness
explanation: Symbols are unique. Every Symbol() call guarantees a new unique symbol, so equality check returns false. Code is 'valid' as in it runs.

title: Missing Argument in Catch
BigInt usage
explanation: Correct syntax for BigInt literals (suffix n) and operations.

title: Unreachable Code
explanation: Code after 'return' statement is unreachable and will never execute. This is a logic error/warning.

title: Strict Mode Default
explanation: By default, JavaScript is in 'loose mode' where implicit globals are allowed. In 'strict mode', this would be an error.

title: Class Method syntax
explanation: Use of 'function' keyword is not allowed for methods inside a class body. Just usage 'method() { ... }'.

title: Array.from usage
explanation: Array.from() creates a new Array instance from an array-like or iterable object (like a string).

title: Super in Object Literal
Closure scope
explanation: The inner arrow function forms a closure and retains access to 'x' from the outer function's scope.

title: Const Object Mutation
Default Parameters
explanation: Default parameter 'arr' is re-evaluated (new array created) each time the function is called without that argument.

title: Yield operator context
explanation: The 'yield' keyword can only be used inside a generator function (function*). 'gen' is a normal function.

title: Spread syntax array
explanation: Spread syntax creates a shallow copy. Modifying a2 does not affect a1.

title: Multiple Constructors
explanation: A class may only have one constructor. Multiple constructors are not allowed.

title: Hoisting let
explanation: Variables declared with 'let' are hoisted but not initialized (Temporal Dead Zone). accessing it before declaration throws ReferenceError.

title: Await in loop
explanation: The 'await' keyword is used inside the arrow function passed to forEach. This arrow function is NOT marked async, so this is a SyntaxError.

title: NaN type
explanation: NaN stands for Not-a-Number, but its type is 'number' in JavaScript.

title: Rest Parameter Position
explanation: Rest parameter '...args' must be the last parameter in the parameter list.

title: Object.is
explanation: Object.is behaves like strict equality but correctly handles NaN and signed zeros.

title: Export Default syntax
explanation: You cannot export a const/let/var declaration as default directly like this. Use 'export default x' after declaration or 'export const x = 10' (named export).

title: WeakMap keys
explanation: WeakMap keys must be objects (or non-registered symbols). Strings are not allowed as keys. Throws TypeError.

title: Label Syntax
explanation: 'loop2' is not defined as a label in the scope. It should be 'break loop1' or definition of loop2.

title: Function default to undefined
explanation: Functions without a return statement return `undefined` by default.

title: Arguments in Arrow func
explanation: Arrow functions do not bind 'arguments'. This refers to enclosing scope's arguments or throws error.

title: parseInt radix
explanation: Second argument to parseInt is the radix (base). '10' in binary (base 2) is 2.

title: Numeric Separator
explanation: Numeric separators (_) are not allowed at the end of a number literal.

title: Optional Chaining
explanation: Optional chaining returns undefined if the base is null or undefined, without throwing an error.

title: Bad Octal Literal
explanation: Decimals with leading zeros are legacy octal literals, but '8' is not a valid octal digit. In strict mode leading zeros are forbidden. In loose mode this parses as 8 but it's confusing/error-prone.

title: Class static method
explanation: Static methods are called on the class itself (C.m()), not on instances (c.m() throws TypeError).

title: Shorthand Method Error
explanation: Space in method name 'my Method'. Property names with spaces must be quoted strings: "my Method"() { }.

title: Infinity
explanation: Division by zero returns Infinity (or -Infinity) in JavaScript.

title: Continue target
explanation: 'continue' statement can only be used within an iteration statement (loop). Here it is inside a function/if block but not a loop.

title: RegExp immutability
explanation: RegExp properties like flags, global, etc. are read-only. Assignment fails (silently or throws in strict).

title: Duplicate Parameter
explanation: Duplicate parameter name 'a'. In strict mode this is a SyntaxError. (Allowed in loose mode but bad practice).

title: Function.length
explanation: Function.length counts parameters up to the first one with a default value. Here only 'a' is counted, so 1.

title: Private field syntax
explanation: Private fields (#name) are only valid inside class declarations. Object literals do not support private fields.

title: Nullish Coalescing
explanation: ?? returns the right-hand operand only if the left is null or undefined. 0 is defined, so it returns 0.

title: Invalid Destructuring
explanation: Object is not iterable, so array destructuring [x, y] fails. Throws TypeError.

title: Proxy creation
explanation: With an empty handler, operations on the proxy are forwarded to the target.

title: Async Generator Error
explanation: Function declaration requires a name. 'async function* ()' is invalid syntax for a declaration (valid as expression).

title: Flat method
explanation: Array.flat(depth) flattens nested arrays up to the specified depth.

title: Invalid logical assignment
explanation: Missing right-hand side operand for logical assignment operator.

title: Object.entries
explanation: Object.entries returns an array of a given object's own enumerable string-keyed property [key, value] pairs.

title: Set method chain
explanation: Set.prototype.delete() (not remove) is used to remove elements, and it returns a boolean, not the Set itself. So chaining after delete is not possible if it were correct method name, but here 'remove' does not exist.

title: Promise.resolve
explanation: Promise callbacks are microtasks and run after the current synchronous code finishes.

title: Prototype assignment
explanation: 'Dog' is not defined. Only 'dog' (instance) and 'Animal' (constructor) are defined.

title: Module top-level await
codeSnippet:
// In a module
const res = await fetch('...');
explanation: Top-level await is supported in modern ES modules.

title: Function default param scope
explanation: Parameter 'x' tries to access 'y' before it is initialized. Parameters are initialized left-to-right. Throws ReferenceError.

title: Object.create null
explanation: Object created with null prototype does not have toString method. Throws TypeError.

title: Invalid super usage
explanation: 'super' keyword is not allowed in regular function declarations/expressions, even if attached to prototype. Only allowed in concise method syntax in objects or classes.

title: Array hole
explanation: Arrays can have empty slots (holes). Length includes them.

title: Duplicate Class Field
explanation:
Duplicate class field names are invalid (except if they are computed names or methods? No, standard fields must be unique? Actually, recent spec might allow it, effectively overwriting. But often flagged. Let's make it a stricter error: `static x = 1; static x = 2;` is definitely error? Actually, let's use a clear syntax error.
Revised code: `class C { constructor() {} constructor() {} }` was used. Let's use `delete super`.
Code: `class C extends B { m() { delete super.x; } }`

title: Symbol key iteration
explanation: for...in loop does not iterate over Symbol properties.

title: Invalid RegExp Fallback
explanation: Invalid regular expression: quantifier '+' with nothing to repeat.

title: Function declaration in block
explanation: In strict mode (and mostly in sloppy mode in modern browsers), function declarations inside blocks are block-scoped.

title: New Target usage
explanation:
Wait, new.target is valid in functions. If called without new, it's undefined. It's NOT an error. Let's use `new.target` outside function.
Code: `const x = new.target;`

title: NaN as key
explanation: Map treats NaN as the same key (even though NaN !== NaN).

title: Method definition
explanation: Getter definition requires parentheses: `get prop() {}`.

title: Intl API
codeSnippet:
const f = new Intl.NumberFormat('en-US', { style: 'currency', currency: 'USD' });
console.log(f.format(10)); // $10.00
explanation: Correct usage of Intl.NumberFormat.

title: Assignment to import
explanation: Imported bindings are live read-only views. Assignment to them throws TypeError.

title: Global this
explanation: globalThis provides a standard way to access the global object.

title: Arguments in Class field
explanation: Class fields are evaluated in context of instance creation, but 'arguments' is only available in function scopes. This throws ReferenceError (or syntax error depending on env).

title: WeakSet iterable
codeSnippet:
const ws = new WeakSet();
for (let x of ws) {}
explanation: WeakSet is not iterable (no keys(), values(), entries() methods). Throws TypeError.

title: Html Comment Syntax
explanation:
HTML comments are valid in non-module JS scripts for legacy reasons! BUT in modules (strict mode), unlikely. However, `-->` is a valid operator sequence (decrement >). `<!--` acts as single line comment. Wait, `<!--` IS valid SingleLineComment in JS Annex B. So this MIGHT be correct. Let's assume strict environment or module where Annex B is restricted? No, Annex B usually applies. Let's use a clearer error.
Revised: `1..toString()`

title: Array sort stability
explanation: Since ES2019, Array.sort is guaranteed to be stable.

title: Octal Escape in String
explanation: Octal escape sequences in string literals are not allowed in strict mode.

title: Reflect API
codeSnippet:
const obj = { x: 1, get y() { return this.x; } };
console.log(Reflect.get(obj, 'y', { x: 2 })); // 2
explanation: Reflect.get takes a receiver argument (3rd arg) which sets 'this' for the getter.

title: Identifier typo
explanation: 'my-var' is interpreted as 'my' minus 'var', not an identifier (hyphens allowed only in property names string). variables 'my' and 'var' not found.

title: Promise.any
explanation: Promise.any resolves with the first fulfilled promise.

title: With statement
explanation: 'with' statement is not allowed in strict mode.

title: BigInt mixing
explanation: Cannot mix BigInt and other types, use explicit conversions. Throws TypeError.

title: Setter without argument
explanation: Setter must have exactly one parameter.

title: Symbol.for
explanation: Symbol.for searches for existing symbols in a global registry with the given key and returns it if found.

title: Exponentiation Operator
explanation: Unary operator used immediately before an exponentiation expression is ambiguous. Parentheses are required: `-(2 ** 2)` or `(-2) ** 2`.

title: JSON.stringify cyclic
explanation: JSON.stringify throws TypeError when trying to stringify a circular structure.

title: Const declaration
explanation: Missing initializer in const declaration.

title: Tagged Template
explanation: strings.raw contains the raw string values where escape sequences are not processed.

title: Await at top level script
codeSnippet:
// In a script tag (not module)
const x = await fetch('/');
explanation: Top-level await is only allowed in modules. In classic scripts it is a SyntaxError.

title: Date parse
explanation: Date.parse returns NaN for unrecognizable strings.

title: Reserved word as prop
explanation:
Wait! Reserved words ARE allowed as property names. This code is Valid. I need an Error.
Revised: `enum` variable name. `const enum = 1;` (enum is reserved in strict mode/future).

title: Array.isArray
explanation: Output is false. Array-like objects are not Arrays.

title: RegExp syntax
explanation: Unterminated character class. Missing closing ']'.

title: Class expression name
codeSnippet:
const C = class Me {};
const c = new Me();
explanation: 'Me' is only visible inside the class definition. Outside, it is not defined. Throws ReferenceError.

title: Invalid Unicode Escape
explanation: Unicode escape sequence \uXXXX requires exactly 4 hex digits. \u00 is invalid.

title: Function bind
explanation: Function.bind returns a new function with 'this' set to the provided value.

title: Invalid assignment left-hand
explanation: Invalid left-hand side in assignment: '2 = x'. Cannot assign to a literal.

title: Math.max args
explanation: Math.max() with no arguments returns -Infinity.

title: Yield in arrow function
explanation: Arrow functions cannot be generators and cannot contain 'yield'.

title: Array empty
explanation: Setting length to 0 empties the array.

title: Duplicate Label
explanation: Label 'L' has already been declared in the scope (outer loop). Shadowing labels is syntax error in strict mode? Actually spec says: 'LabelledItem : Identifier : Statement ... It is a Syntax Error if any Statement ... contains a label named Identifier'. So yes.

title: Arguments callee
explanation: Access to 'arguments.callee' is forbidden in strict mode. Throws TypeError.

title: Throw expression
explanation: 'throw' is a statement, not an expression. Cannot be used in assignment (unless 'throw expressions' proposal is active, but traditionally invalid).

title: Private method in object
explanation: Private methods (#name) are only valid in class definitions, not object literals.

title: Object.assign vs Spread
explanation: Object.assign triggers setters on the target. Object spread ({...target}) defines new properties.

title: Super in static method
explanation: 'super()' (constructor call) is only valid in the class constructor. In static methods, 'super.prop' is valid, but 'super()' is not.

title: Promise.race
explanation: Promise.race settles as soon as the first promise settles (resolves or rejects). Here rejection happens first.

title: Yield star context
explanation: 'yield*' expression requires an iterable object. Number '1' is not iterable. Throws TypeError at runtime.

title: Symbol as object key stringification
explanation: JSON.stringify ignores symbol-keyed properties.

title: Async constructor
explanation: Class constructors cannot be async.

title: Array splice return
explanation: Array.splice returns an array of the removed elements.

title: Break across function
explanation: 'break' cannot cross function boundaries. You cannot break to a label outside the current function.

title: Module strict mode
explanation: Modules are always in strict mode. Assigning to undeclared variable 'a' throws ReferenceError.

title: Invalid destructuring default
explanation: Cannot destructure 'null' or 'undefined'. Throws TypeError.

title: Class expression
codeSnippet:
const C = class { constructor() {} };
new C();
explanation: Class expressions can be anonymous.

title: Import.meta context
explanation: 'import.meta' is only available inside modules.

title: Number.EPSILON
explanation: Due to floating point precision, 0.1 + 0.2 is slightly larger than 0.3.

title: Rest element must be last
explanation: Rest element used in destructuring must be the last element.

title: Array.of
explanation: Array.of(3) creates an array [3], whereas Array(3) creates an empty array of length 3.

title: For await of context
explanation: 'for await...of' is only allowed in async functions and async generators (and top-level modules). 'f' is a sync function.

title: Symbol.toPrimitive
explanation: Symbol.toPrimitive allows customizing object coercion.

title: Super property access in function
explanation: 'super' keyword is not allowed in function declarations.

title: Object.seal
explanation: Object.seal prevents adding/removing properties but allows modifying existing writable properties.

title: Logical Assignment Syntax
explanation:
Wait, ||= is valid logical assignment operator (ES2021). Unless 'a' is not defined? Yes. If 'a' is undeclared, this is ReferenceError. But syntax wise it is valid. Let's make it syntax error.
Revised: `a || = b;` (space).

title: Global isNaN vs Number.isNaN
explanation: Global isNaN coerces argument to number (NaN), so returns true. Number.isNaN checks if value IS NaN type, returns false.

title: Export inside function
explanation: 'export' declaration must be at the top level of the module.

title: String iterator
explanation: Strings are iterable, so spread syntax works.

title: Generator arrow
explanation: Arrow functions cannot be generators.

title: WeakRef
explanation: WeakRef holds a weak reference to the object.

title: Class field without initializer
explanation: 'const' keyword is not allowed for class fields. Just use 'x = 1;' or 'static x = 1;'.

title: FinalizationRegistry
codeSnippet:
const registry = new FinalizationRegistry(v => console.log(v));
// Valid usage?
explanation: Correct syntax for creating FinalizationRegistry.

title: Null coalescing precedence
explanation: Cannot mix '||' and '??' without parentheses due to precedence ambiguity. Must use `(1 || 2) ?? 3` or similar.

title: Array.reduce initial value
explanation: Calling reduce on empty array without initial value throws TypeError.

title: Delete identifier strict
explanation: Deleting a variable/identifier is a SyntaxError in strict mode.

title: Function.caller
explanation: Accessing 'caller' property on strict mode function throws TypeError.

title: Invalid numeric literal
explanation: Legacy octal literals (0123) are Forbidden in strict mode. Assuming strict mode (or module). Loose mode allows it.

title: String padStart
explanation: padStart adds padding to the start of string.

title: Let redeclaration in switch
explanation: Switch block is a single scope. Redeclaring 'let y' in the same block is a SyntaxError. Use blocks {} for cases.

title: Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors
explanation: It retrieves property descriptors, including getters/setters.

title: Invalid escape in template
explanation: Invalid unicode escape sequence in template literal forces checking valid escape sequences, unless it's a tagged template (ES2018 revision). In untagged template, this is SyntaxError.

title: SharedArrayBuffer
explanation: SharedArrayBuffer allows sharing memory between agents.

title: Continue with invalid label
explanation: 'continue' can only refer to a label of a visible ITERATION statement. 'foo' labels a BLOCK, not a loop. SyntaxError.

title: Function.prototype.toString
codeSnippet:
function f() { /* */ }
console.log(f.toString()); // returns source code
explanation: Function.prototype.toString return a string representing the source code of the function.

title: RegExp lookbehind syntax
explanation:
This is valid logic, but older browsers might throw SyntaxError. However, standard JS supports it. Finding a real syntax error in regex.
Revised: `/(?a)b/` (invalid group syntax).

title: Array.prototype.at
explanation: .at() supports negative indexing.

title: Invalid BigInt Literal
explanation: BigInt literals must be integers. 1.5n is invalid syntax.

title: JSON.stringify undefined
explanation: JSON.stringify omits properties with undefined values.

title: Duplicate proto
explanation: Defining '__proto__' more than once in an object literal is a SyntaxError.

title: Set has NaN
explanation: Set treats NaN as equal to itself.

title: Invalid argument for super
explanation: 'super' is a keyword, not a function object. You cannot call 'call', 'apply', or 'bind' on it. Usage is `super()`.

title: Object.fromEntries
explanation: Object.fromEntries transforms a list of key-value pairs into an object.

title: Invalid Unicode Sequence
explanation: Unicode code point out of range (max 10FFFF). \u{110000} is invalid.

title: AggregateError
explanation: AggregateError works as expected, storing errors in .errors property.

title: Invalid decorator syntax
explanation: Decorators are currently only valid on classes and class members (stage 3 proposal), not on function declarations.

title: Proxy invariant
explanation: If target property is non-writable and non-configurable, the proxy's get trap must return the same value. Returning 2 violates invariant.

title: Super in eval
explanation: 'super' keyword is not allowed in function declarations, even inside eval. It needs a home object (method context).

title: Symbol key string coercion
explanation: Symbols cannot be implicitly converted to strings (e.g. via concatenation). Throws TypeError.

title: Duplicate parameter strict
explanation: Duplicate parameter names are SyntaxError in strict mode.

title: Atomics.add
explanation: Atomics.add atomically adds a value to an array element.

title: Arrow function new
explanation: Arrow functions are not constructors and cannot be used with 'new'. Throws TypeError.

title: RegExp sticky flag
explanation: Sticky flag (y) matches only from the index indicated by lastIndex.

title: Yield in constructor
explanation: Constructors cannot be generator functions.

title: Negative zero equality
explanation: Strict equality treats +0 and -0 as equal.

title: Invalid BigInt conversion
explanation: BigInt() throws RangeError if passed a number that is not an integer.

title: WeakMap value GC
explanation: WeakMap holds weak references to KEYS, but strong references to VALUES. v is reachable via wm.get(k) as long as k is reachable.

title: Use strict position
explanation:
'use strict' directive must be at the top of the function body (before any statements). Here it effectively does nothing (not an error technically but logic/intention error). But browsers don't throw error. Let's make it a syntax error.
Revised: `function f(a=1) { 'use strict'; }`

title: Strict function parameters
explanation: SyntaxError: Illegal 'use strict' directive in function with non-simple parameter list (defaults, destructuring, or rest).

title: Invalid loop label
explanation: Label 'label' is defined AFTER use? No, loop blocks are lexical. But here 'break label' is inside first loop, label is on second. Scopes are siblings. Label is not visible.

title: Reflect.construct
explanation: Reflect.construct allows creating instance using A's logic but B's prototype (new.target).

title: Generator return type
codeSnippet:
function* g() { yield 1; }
const val = new g();
explanation: Generator functions cannot be used as constructors. 'new g()' throws TypeError: g is not a constructor.

title: Set forEach return
explanation: forEach always returns undefined.

title: Const assignment in destructuring
explanation: Variable 'a' is const. Assignment throws TypeError.

title: Proxy revocable
explanation: Accessing properties on a revoked proxy throws TypeError. The code crashes, so 'isCodeCorrect' is false.

title: Delete unconfigurable
explanation: Object.prototype is non-configurable. In strict mode, deleting it throws TypeError.

title: Promise constructor sync
explanation: The executor function passed to Promise constructor runs synchronously.

title: Invalid octal strict
explanation: Legacy octal literals (010) are forbidden in strict mode.

title: Array.prototype.flat defaults
explanation: Default depth for flat is 1.

title: Async await precedence
explanation:
Parses as `return (await 1) + 2;` which is valid. Is it error? No. Let's make syntax error.
Revised: `await function(){}` inside async (await requires expression). syntax valid. `await + 1` valid. `await` as variable in module: error.

title: Function.name property
explanation: The 'name' property is set to the name of the function expression ('g').

title: Tagged template syntax
explanation: Syntax error. `tag`a`b`` parses as `tag` call on `a`, then `b` which is identifier? No. `tag`...` `...`. `tag`a`` is call. `b` is identifier. ` is start of new template? Unclosed. SyntaxError.

title: Object.isExtensible
explanation: Frozen objects are non-extensible.

title: Import.meta assignment
explanation: import.meta is read-only (it is not a variable, it's a meta property).

title: Symbol.species
explanation: Symbol.species overrides default constructor choice for derived objects. It returns Array, so mapped is Array, not MyArray.

title: Undefined property read
explanation: Cannot read property 'prop' of undefined. Throws TypeError.

title: RegExp dotAll
explanation: s flag (dotAll) allows dot (.) to match newlines.

title: Bad continuation
explanation: Unlabeled 'break' must be inside a loop or switch. Inside if (that is not in loop/switch) it is SyntaxError.

title: BigInt bitwise
explanation: Bitwise operators work on BigInts.

title: Throw without argument
explanation: 'throw' must be followed by an expression. Empty throw is SyntaxError (unlike 'return').

title: String normalize
explanation: normalize('NFD') decomposes characters canonical decomposition.

title: Invalid Try Catch
explanation: 'catch' block must precede 'finally' block.

title: Object.setPrototypeOf null
explanation: Setting prototype to null removes Object.prototype methods like toString.

title: Numeric separator placement
explanation:
Numeric separator allowed. Wait, `1._23` is error. `1.2_3` is valid. I need error.
Revised: `let x = 1__2;` (multiple underscores).

title: Private field in
explanation: The 'in' operator works with private fields to check brand.

title: Logical assignment const
explanation: Assignment to constant variable via logical assignment. Throws TypeError.

title: Temporal Dead Zone
explanation: Even typeof is not safe for TDZ variables. Throws ReferenceError.

title: Yield in global
explanation: Yield is only valid inside generator functions. Global yield is SyntaxError (in strict mode or module).

title: Function default eval
codeSnippet:
function f(a, b = a) { return b; }
console.log(f(1)); // 1
explanation: Default parameters can reference previous parameters.

title: Async await top level script
explanation: Top-level await is not allowed in classic scripts, only in modules.

title: RegExp matchAll
explanation: matchAll returns an iterator of matches.

title: Invalid RegExp Group
explanation: Backreference \k<other> refers to non-existent group 'other'.

title: Array includes NaN
explanation: Yes, includes handles NaN correctly.

title: With in module
explanation: Modules are strict mode. 'with' is forbidden.

title: Class static initialization block
explanation: Correct syntax for static initialization blocks.

title: Invalid unicode in identifier
explanation: \u{0030} corresponds to digit '0'. Identifiers cannot start with a digit, even if escaped. SyntaxError.

title: Private field in proxy
explanation: Accessing private fields on a proxy fails because the 'this' value inside getX is the proxy, which does not have the private slot. Code throws TypeError, so isCodeCorrect is false.

title: Super property deletion
explanation: Deleting a property on 'super' throws ReferenceError (or SyntaxError depending on engine, spec says ReferenceError). It is invalid.

title: Symbol.unscopables
explanation: Symbol.unscopables hides 'a' from the 'with' scope, so 'a' is not resolved from obj.

title: Nullish coalescing mixed
explanation: Mixing '&&' and '??' without parentheses is a SyntaxError.

title: Intl.Segmenter
codeSnippet:
const seg = new Intl.Segmenter('en', { granularity: 'grapheme' });
console.log([...seg.segment('')].length); // 1
explanation: Intl.Segmenter correctly handles complex emojis as single grapheme clusters.

title: Async generator arrow
explanation: Arrow functions cannot be generators, even async ones.

title: Promise.any rejection
explanation: If all promises reject, Promise.any rejects with AggregateError.

title: For-in with initializer
explanation: for-in loop variable declaration cannot have an initializer (in strict mode). In non-strict it is ignored, but logically it's often confused. Wait, `for (var i = 0 in {})` IS invalid in strict mode.

title: Object.getOwnPropertySymbols
explanation: Retrieves symbol properties.

title: Rest parameter default
explanation: Rest parameter cannot have a default value.

title: Function.prototype.callee
explanation: Accessing arguments.callee is forbidden in strict mode. Throws TypeError.

title: Redundant flag
explanation: Duplicate flag 'u' in regular expression. SyntaxError.

title: DataView endianness
explanation: Second argument to getUint16 is isLittleEndian. Bytes 01 00 in LE is 0001 (value 1).

title: Optional chaining assignment
explanation: The optional chaining operator (?.) cannot be used on the left-hand side of an assignment.

title: WeakSet iterable
codeSnippet:
const ws = new WeakSet([{}, {}]);
console.log(ws.has({})); // false
explanation: WeakSet logic is correct. New object created checks return false.

title: Invalid hex escape
explanation: Hex escape sequence \x must be followed by exactly 2 hex digits. \x1 is invalid.

title: Object.is with signed zero
explanation: Object.is distinguishes between +0 and -0.

title: Duplicate class constructor
explanation: A class may only have one constructor.

title: Array sort stability
explanation: Array.sort is stable since ES2019.

title: Await in parameter default
explanation: Await expression is not allowed in parameter default values, even in async functions.

title: URLSearchParams sort
explanation: URLSearchParams has a sort method.

title: Exponentiation ambiguity
explanation: Unary operator cannot be used immediately before exponentiation expression without grouping. Must be `(-2) ** 2`.

title: Symbol.matchAll
explanation: String.prototype.matchAll defers to [Symbol.matchAll] method of argument.

title: Class field arguments
explanation: 'arguments' object is not valid in class field initializers (unless inside a function in the field).

title: Error.cause
codeSnippet:
const e = new Error('msg', { cause: new Error('root') });
console.log(e.cause.message); // 'root'
explanation: Error cause property is standard.

title: Proto setter in literal
explanation:
Computed property name `['__proto__']` does NOT set the prototype. It sets a regular property named '__proto__'. Not a syntax error, but usually a logic bug. Wait, this instructions say 'Find error'. If it's valid JS, I should check if it's an 'error' in intention. But let's find a real syntax error.
Revised: `function f() { if(1) function g(){} }` (Function in block strict vs sloppy). Let's do `08` in strict.

title: Function decl in block strict
explanation: In strict mode, function declarations in blocks are block-scoped. 'f' is not visible outside the if block.

title: Array iterator keys
explanation: Array.prototype.keys() returns iterator of indices.

title: Meta property new.target
explanation:
This is valid! new.target is undefined in normal calls. Wait. I need an error.
Error: `new.target = 1` assignment.

title: Assign new.target
explanation: new.target is read-only.

title: Promise.resolve thenable
codeSnippet:
const thenable = { then(r) { r(1); } };
Promise.resolve(thenable).then(v => console.log(v)); // 1
explanation: Promise.resolve unwraps thenables.

title: Invalid label shadow
explanation: Duplicate label 'loop' in the same function scope is a SyntaxError.

title: Set value equality
explanation: Distinct object literals are not equal.

title: Import named default
explanation: 'default' is a keyword. Must use `import { default as name }` or `import name`.

title: Math.hypot
explanation: Returns square root of sum of squares.

title: Class extends null super
explanation: If class extends null, constructor must return an object explicitly. Calling super() is TypeError because there is no super constructor.

title: Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER
explanation: Precision loss beyond MAX_SAFE_INTEGER.

title: Getter parameter
explanation: Getter must have exactly zero parameters.

title: Reflect.apply
explanation: Reflect.apply(func, thisArg, args).

title: Setter parameter count
explanation: Setter must have exactly one parameter.

title: TypedArray.from
explanation: 256 wraps to 0 in Uint8.

title: Invalid spread in object
explanation:
This is valid! numbers spread to nothing. error needed.
Error: `const o = { ... }` (empty spread) -> Syntax Error? No.
Revised: `const o = { ...identifier }` is valid.
Revised: `const arr = [ ...obj ];` where obj is not iterable.

title: Spread non-iterable
explanation: Object is not iterable by default. Spreading it in array is TypeError.

title: Object.preventExtensions
explanation: Fails silently in loose mode, throws in strict. Property not added.

title: Duplicate default export
explanation: Only one default export allowed per module.

title: Bound function construction
explanation: 'new' operator ignores the bound 'this' value.

title: Return outside function
explanation: 'return' statement not in function. SyntaxError.

title: Proxy trap invariance target
codeSnippet:
const p = new Proxy({}, { getPrototypeOf() { return null; } });
Object.getPrototypeOf(p); // null
explanation: If target is not extensible, proxy must return same prototype. Target is extensible here. BUT, `null` is valid return? Yes. Is it correct? Yes. Wait, why false? let's check invariant. 'If target is extensible, getPrototypeOf can return any object or null'. YES. So it IS correct. I will set to true.

title: Proxy preventExtensions false
codeSnippet:
const p = new Proxy({}, { preventExtensions() { return false; } });
Object.preventExtensions(p); // Throws TypeError
explanation: If Object.preventExtensions(proxy) is called, the trap must return true if it successfully calls Object.preventExtensions(target). If it returns false, operation throws TypeError.

title: Invalid method in class
explanation: Method definitions in classes do not use the 'function' keyword.

title: Symbol.replace
explanation: String.replace uses Symbol.replace if present.

title: Switch multiple defaults
explanation: More than one default clause in switch statement is SyntaxError.

title: Date invalid
codeSnippet:
const d = new Date('invalid');
console.log(isNaN(d)); // true
explanation: Invalid date becomes Invalid Date object, whose numeric value is NaN.

title: Invalid atomic wait
explanation: Atomics.wait is not allowed on the main thread standard browser environments (it blocks). It throws TypeError.

title: Array.fromAsync
explanation: Array.fromAsync (ES2024) creates array from async iterable.

title: WeakMap iterable key
explanation:
Symbols allowed as WeakMap keys? Yes, if registered? No, only objects and registered symbols. Wait, un-registered symbols are allowed as WeakMap keys in recent spec updates (stage 3/4). `Symbol('k')` is unique. So it IS allowed now. I need a definitive error.
Error: `wm.set(1, 1)` (primitive key).

title: WeakMap primitive key
explanation: WeakMap keys must be objects or non-registered symbols. Primitives like numbers are not allowed.

title: Object.groupBy
explanation: Object.groupBy (ES2024) groups array items.

title: Super dot property
explanation:
Accessing 'super' in a class that does not extend anything (and has no prototype set manually) is ... valid? `Object.getPrototypeOf(C)` is `Function.prototype`. `super.x` looks up `Function.prototype.x`. It is valid undefined. I need an Error.
Error: `super` in object literal method without proto?

title: Label not found
explanation: Cannot break to a label across function boundaries.

title: Resizable ArrayBuffer
explanation: ArrayBuffers can be resizable if options are provided.

title: Constructor return primitive
explanation:
Returning a primitive from a constructor is ignored (returns 'this'). Not an error. Usage issue? No. ErrorSpotting must be ERROR (runtime or syntax). 
Error: `new Arrow()`.

title: Duplicate class field
explanation:
It IS valid. The second field overwrites. 
Error: `const enum`? No typescript. 
Error: `with` in strict mode.

title: With in class
explanation: Classes are always strict mode. 'with' is forbidden in strict mode.

title: Array.toSorted
explanation: toSorted (ES2023) returns a new sorted array, leaving original unchanged.

title: Function params expression strict
explanation: Cannot use 'use strict' in function with default parameters.

title: Promise.withResolvers
explanation: Promise.withResolvers (ES2024) is standard.
